page.title: 17TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: A group of children undertook a survey of all the traffic going through the centre of Madeley Village, along the A525 from Newcastle-under-Lyme to Whitchurch and Wrexham. The survey was done in short, twenty minute "bursts", giving a fairly accu- rate picture of traffic movement. During any hour observed, there were between 280 and 370 cars passing through the village, and the following details are typical of what we found in one hour:- 284 cars 27 lorries 35 small vans 6 tractors 7 buses 36 other vehicles At certain times in the year, traffic through Madeley is greatly increased, as it is a main route from the Pottery towns out to the coast of North and Mid Wales, and to the Snowdonia National Park.
